subject.name: Engineering Chemistry
subject.description: Introduces the fundamentals of chemistry relevant to engineering, focusing on atomic and molecular structures, spectroscopy, electrochemistry, water chemistry, polymers, and organic synthesis. Emphasizes applications of chemical principles in materials, fuels, corrosion, and industrial processes.
objectives: To understand the atomic and molecular structure and bonding theories
To study spectroscopy and its applications to molecular systems
To learn electrochemical principles, corrosion mechanisms, and fuel types
To understand water chemistry and methods for hardness removal
To study polymers, plastics, and their industrial importance
To gain an introduction to organic reaction mechanisms and drug synthesis

units.title: Atomic and Molecular Structure
topics: Electromagnetic radiations and dual nature of electron
Heisenberg uncertainty principle
Photoelectric effect and Planck’s theory
Combination of atomic orbitals and molecular orbital theory
Bent’s rule and VSEPR theory with examples
Coordination numbers, geometries, and isomerism in transition metal complexes
Metal carbonyls: synthesis and structure

units.title: Spectroscopy
topics: Principle of rotational and vibrational spectroscopy
Selection rules and applications to diatomic molecules
Basics of electronic spectroscopy and UV-VIS applications
Basic principle of Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectroscopy and applications

units.title: Electrochemistry and Fuels
topics: Nernst equation and electrochemical cells
Introduction to corrosion, corrosion mechanisms and types: waterline, stress, and pitting corrosion
Lead-acid and dry cell (Lachlanche) batteries
Calorific value of fuels and coal analysis
Fuel cells and biofuels

units.title: Water Chemistry
topics: Hardness of water: estimation by EDTA and alkalinity method
Removal of hardness: soda-lime, zeolite, and ion-exchange processes
Boiler problems: sludge and scale formation, priming and foaming
Boiler corrosion and caustic embrittlement

units.title: Polymers and Plastics
topics: Polymerization techniques: free radical, ionic, and coordination mechanisms
Preparation, properties, and applications of phenol-formaldehyde resins, elastomers, and synthetic rubbers (Buna-N, Buna-S, neoprene)
Inorganic polymers: silicones, adhesives, and epoxy resins
Thermoplastics vs. thermosetting plastics
Commercially important thermoplastics: polyethylene, polyvinyl chloride, and polystyrene

units.title: Organic Reactions and Drug Synthesis
topics: Intermediates and reactions: substitution, addition, elimination, oxidation-reduction, cyclization, and epoxide ring opening
Synthesis of commonly used drug molecules

suggested_books: University Chemistry by B.H. Mahan, Pearson
Chemistry: Principles and Applications by M.J. Sienko and R.A. Plane, McGraw Hill
Fundamentals of Molecular Spectroscopy by C.N. Banwell, McGraw Hill
Engineering Chemistry (NPTEL Web Book) by B.L. Tembe and Kamaluddin
Physical Chemistry by P.W. Atkins, Oxford University Press
A Text Book of Engineering Chemistry by S. Chawla, Dhanpat Rai Publications
General Chemistry Part I by Sarkar, New Central Book Agency
